Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different types of habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, parking lot, pond, stream, or lake.
The student can illustrate various living things found in each habitat, including plants like trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can depict different animals that live in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can show comparisons by illustrating different living things across multiple habitats to highlight diversity.
The student can observe and represent patterns of biodiversity, showing how plants and animals vary between habitats.
